cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west toward the south-central Texas coast, then forecast to bend west-southwest inland over south Texas/northern Mexico

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch none; no tropical storm watches posted north of San Luis Pass
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Baffin Bay to Mesquite Bay; Tropical Storm Warning Mouth of Rio Grande to Baffin Bay AND Mesquite Bay to San Luis Pass
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central Texas coast from the Mouth of the Rio Grande to San Luis Pass with secondary impacts northward to High Island/Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation possible in Galveston Bay and north of Sargent to High Island
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain totaling 3–5 inches with localized amounts just over 4 inches could produce urban and low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along upper Texas coast; brief tornadoes possible overnight into Saturday
